description:
We're heading into a future of delivery drones, driverless cars and
3D-printed "hoverboards" ...

With machines now able to perform many tasks better than humans, some
people are going to be out of a job.

But not software developers, right?! Could a computer generate the
code you currently write for a living?

In this talk, we'll take a look at one of the many biologically
inspired approaches to AI - Genetic Algorithms, and how they can be
used to generate code given a description of the function that that
code should perform.

Spoiler - you're probably not out of a job, yet...
title: Writing code? Pfft... Evolve it instead!
